channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights not functioning properly, 12th June
item.description:
When approaching southbound the lights only let one or two cars through at a time. I have noticed this seems to be the case whenever there is a car approaching from the eastern side road, as if priority is given to cars approaching those lights. This is causing significant tailbacks along Kingsditch as far back as Hyde lane in rush hour and along Swindon Road as far back as Wymans lane . This is causing an environmental impact due to the sheer volume of cars caught in unnecessary traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: MASSIVE pothole across the entire lane, 12th June
item.description:
On westbound carriageway of Old Gloucester Road, just before Pilgrove Way, the entire lane is covered by a massive deep pothole across the entire lane. You have to swerve across the road to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, William Gough Close, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pothole across the whole lane, 12th June
item.description:
West bound carraigeway, just before Pilgrove Way, covers the entire lane, very deep, need to swerve across the road to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Dormer Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 12th June
item.description:
Email received 11/06/2024 - copy attached. Customer reports a tree which has branches in very close proximity to the building at the location and is blocking out sunlight.

item.title: Japanese Knotweed problem, 12th June
item.description:

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 12th June
item.description:
Grass verge is very high, you cannot see traffic coming in either direction unless you pull right out, so dangerous. Council have planted moon daisies are obstructing the traffic coming from Tewkesbury. On RHS its the tall grass, obstructing traffic coming from Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
